boat.name: Dorcis
boat.full_description:
The Albert Strange Association reported that Albert Strange designed Birdie in 1898 and very soon after she was built in 1899 - 1900 the name was changed to Dorcis.

They had believed she had been gutted by fire at Maldon c.1965. However there are pictures of her in the East Coast Race 1965 and records of her racing in the 1964 - 1971 East Coast races.

OGA records note her being altered to cutter in 1924 and back to yawl in 1964. She then became a ketch, then a cutter and back to ketch. The last information says she was lost at sea, in the Mediterranean, 1974.
boat.short_description: An Albert Strange yacht, believed to have been lost in 1965, has been found in the East Coast OGA records, being lost at sea, 1974.
